lines.text:
[to three lady musicians playing in the lounge of the "Green Man" inn]
Ladies! I've never heard a trio play with such brio! And, after that perfectly-judged andantino, perhaps you'd join me in a little vino?

my abominable headmaster. Really, all I did was to put an electric charge in his fountain pen and an explosive in the inkpot. I honestly only intended to humiliate him. However, that got rid of him, and it also disposed of any doubts I may have had about my true vocation.

[fending off Charlie Boughtflower's amorous attentions - but not too hard]
Oh, Charlie, you are dreadful!
[Reginald Willoughby-Cruft is a pompous BBC radio announcer. He has discovered vacuum-cleaner salesman William Blake in various compromising situations with his fiancée]

[to William Blake]
By heaven! I'd thrash the life out of you... if I didn't have to read the nine-o'clock news.
